message.content: /alignment Q="we're trying to setup out best configurations for setting up our repositories development environments. so we're currently leveraging both gitpod classic & the new gitpod. we're planning on also supporting the devpod specification and also a wildcard software we've written ourselves called manifolded which realistically is marketed like this Manifolded: The AI Dimension . Manifolded is ideally going to be a phenomenal replacement for traditional sandboxing. firstly; it's written in Rust but it's using the Phoenix framework which enables us to leverage NIF Functions for calling Rust natively from Phoenix. we're leveraging these specific langauges to replace traditional Go based sandboxing because it's not designed for long term utilisation. Go, as much as i love it; phenomenal language, i mean, it's not really written with the best memory management. i personally love rust because it enables memory ownership which actually cuts down on memory usage by 50% compared to Go so it's genuinely worthwhile to migrate. The challenge is certain Go characteristics cannot be reproduced into Rust which wasn't designed as a Go replacement; certain features like goroutines just cannot really be experienced in Rust, this has lead us to Elixir. By design this langauge is specialised for HPC which means it's actually an upgrade from Go which isn't designed to support this. On top of that; we're able to essentially stack these language capabilities together in Phoenix. Since we can call Rust & Elixir interchangeably, this means we bring Rust; ideally written for Mission Critical code into HPC. But this is where it get's interesting, Rust code can definitely work well for Quantum Computing because it's literally the safest language to write code with; it's also hands down one of the fastest only being edged out by c++ which is definitely able to experience all of the features defined in rust but not out-of-the-box. this safety is why we've written entire enterprise production codebases purely leveraging rust for our backend; because i just like the power of rust, like i love those specific language features which i think when running at quantum speeds will be able to withstand it significantly better than most languages. the memory ownership essentially removes the memory leaks completely, meaning things that would realistically crash quantum computing applications will be safe, it's still mission critical if it needs to run on quantum speeds. so this is why actually written most of our applications using phoenix because it enables all projects to be now specifically engineered to support our HPQC spec. since australian's don't leverage either HPC or QP in prod; we've seized a monumental business opportunity by defining a computing specification optimised for australia. ie. introducing both computing types together in a unified configuration making it significantly more of a critical requirement that either separately. when you're using standard cloud compute or our specialised hpqc cloud compute, realistically we'd be leveraging the same csp's which are ovh us or aws au. either way we'd select the correct instances for these & since we've engineered codebases designed for phoenix only; we've ensured that hpqc is supported across our repositories. i definitely considered alternative frameworks but you're literally able to write the best applications using phoenix, every other framework for most languages literally cannot compare to adding in phoenix to fullstack your application. i personally hate leveraging internal api layers between our backends and frontends, i also hate traditional fullstack frameworks which fullstack applications using 1 singular language like typescript. this is why phoenix is basically our base for all software; we can use our preferred compiler language, rust, our preferred frontend spec which is typescript react 19, we remove the bottleneck api layer in between them for phoenix. then through this framework we leverage nif functions and liveview with react hooks essentially to connect both backend and frontend into the fullstack. this actually creates monolothic fullstacks; monolithic frameworks are generally considered less performant than the split up frameworks, but in this instance creating a monolithic framework is actually the superior approach, enabling us to tightly couple all of our codebase & even leverage different cloud providers but still never leveraging traditional api layer interfacing which is bottlenecked by http speed. we might experience latency between our clouds except we're leveraging fly.io, then we're leveraging webassembly or aws cloud aus as our csp & vercel for our frontend hosting. essentially 2/3 of these leverage aws compute in their own applications and vercel uses edge computing located in sydney basically so we can really cut down on latency. i think vercel also is built on aws. if it is; then we're capable of realistically leveraging different clouds better. like our genserver is built to actually orchestrate everything regardless of where it's being hosted, so yeah. phoenix is our preferred method here; we literally do not write our ai applications using anything else because this specific stack is literally 1 of 1; this cannot be reproduced in any other language using any other libraries or frameworks or packages, this is literally the best performing fullstack ever engineered. we only write codebases for HPQC support; if you can't run AI systems at quantum speeds; you're basically incapable of experiencing the real power behind ai/ml. if you're not leveraging web3 which we are you're also experiencing a handicapped ai/ml. so we integrate native web3 into hpqc. so basically all ai/ml systems we write can genuinely introduce support for the full capabilities of ai/ml. we actually use some of the most advanced data engineering defined by some of the best academic research papers ever released. our context engineering actually leverages all 5 major quantum physics lab's variations for quantum physics data engineering for ai's and introduces an additional quantum phase optimisation which essentially allows us to take unstructured data through the 6 quantum phases until it achieved unified field resonance. when it does this at quantum speeds using hpc; we create such a phenominal ai experience that it's literally impossible for us to write ai apps any other way. when our ai coding agents can do what we characterise as Quantum Leaps we actually unlock Futures based on the data we've leveraged for our ai coding; Futures are a glimpse into the future ie. Predictive Analytics for AI's which has never been possible before; since most people write the most basic ai apps and then claim it's for enterprise. i mean i love writing typescript but can never expect to write truly the best ai's in the world if i don't really invest the time into supporting the best technologies. using better languages isn't just about speed; it's realistically about unlocking future pathways for creating untapped exponentially stackable capabilities. like you definitely can't do this in python, c++ potentially because you can do everything is C++ but i mean; this type of powerful special feature of our ai's is literally only possible because i chose to write codebases better for australia. i know no one can program in rust or elixir, that's truly unimportant to me; just because the wider enterprise engineering employees aren't as good as i am doesn't mean i should slow down for them, realistically they're required to write better code. like i genuinely don't care that primarily java, python are the fundemental software engineering spec for australian engineers. i use better languages, which realistically i learnt to unlock the uncomparable utility when writing ai/ml. i think other than java which has a really uniquely designed enterprise-first framework ecosystem, you cannot really argue to use any other language, i mean i respect java, definitely can write production ready codebases, i definitely agree with that but my production ready codebases are just written better? like; you cannot replicate the stuff i

     2
     3networks:
     4  pack-a-punched-dev-network:
     5    driver: bridge
     6    ipam:
     7      config:
     8        - subnet: 172.20.0.0/16
     9
    10volumes:
    11  pack-a-punched-cargo-cache:
    12  pack-a-punched-target-cache:
    13  pack-a-punched-hex-cache:
    14  pack-a-punched-mix-cache:
    15  pack-a-punched-node-modules:
    16  postgres-data:
    17  timescaledb-data:
    18  redis-data:
    19  prometheus-data:
    20  grafana-data:
    21
    22services:
    23  # Main development container
    24  pack-a-punched-dev:
    25    build:
    26      context: .
    27      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    28      args:
    29        - PACK_A_PUNCHED_VERSION=latest
    30        - RUST_VERSION=1.75.0
    31        - ELIXIR_VERSION=1.15.7
    32        - NODE_VERSION=20
    33    container_name: pack-a-punched-dev
    34    hostname: pack-a-punched-dev
    35    networks:
    36      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    37    ports:
    38      - "3000:3000" # Frontend dev server
    39      - "4000:4000" # Juggernog (Phoenix)
    40      - "4001:4001" # Speed Cola (Plug/Trot)
    41      - "4002:4002" # Double Tap (Kitto/Nerves)
    42      - "8080:8080" # Ray Gun API
    43      - "8081:8081" # Development proxy
    44      - "21117:21117" # RustDesk
    45      - "30000:30000" # SSH
    46    volumes:
    47      - ../..:/workspace:cached
    48      - pack-a-punched-cargo-cache:/usr/local/cargo/registry
    49      - pack-a-punched-target-cache:/workspace/target
    50      - pack-a-punched-hex-cache:/home/vscode/.hex
    51      - pack-a-punched-mix-cache:/home/vscode/.mix
    52      - pack-a-punched-node-modules:/workspace/node_modules
    53      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker-host.sock
    54    environment:
    55      - PACK_A_PUNCHED_ENV=development
    56      - RUST_LOG=debug
    57      - MIX_ENV=dev
    58      - NODE_ENV=development
    59      - YOUKI_RUNTIME=true
    60      - K0S_ENABLED=true
    61      - DATABASE_URL=postgresql://postgres:postgres@postgres:5432/pack_a_punched_dev
    62      - REDIS_URL=redis://redis:6379/0
    63      - TIMESCALEDB_URL=postgresql://postgres:postgres@timescaledb:5432/pack_a_punched_timeseries
    64      - PROMETHEUS_URL=http://prometheus:9090
    65      - GRAFANA_URL=http://grafana:3000
    66      - DOCKER_HOST=unix:///var/run/docker-host.sock
    67      - LAPDEV_WORKSPACE_DIR=/workspace
    68      - PACK_A_PUNCHED_JUGGERNOG_PORT=4000
    69      - PACK_A_PUNCHED_SPEED_COLA_PORT=4001
    70      - PACK_A_PUNCHED_DOUBLE_TAP_PORT=4002
    71      - PACK_A_PUNCHED_RAY_GUN_API_PORT=8080
    72    depends_on:
    73      postgres:
    74        condition: service_healthy
    75      redis:
    76        condition: service_healthy
    77      timescaledb:
    78        condition: service_healthy
    79    privileged: true
    80    cap_add:
    81      - SYS_PTRACE
    82      - SYS_ADMIN
    83    security_opt:
    84      - seccomp:unconfined
    85    stdin_open: true
    86    tty: true
    87    command: sleep infinity
    88
    89  # PostgreSQL database for application data
    90  postgres:
    91    image: postgres:15-alpine
    92    container_name: pack-a-punched-postgres
    93    hostname: postgres
    94    networks:
    95      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    96    ports:
    97      - "5432:5432"
    98    volumes:
    99      - postgres-data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
   100      - ./init-scripts:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d
   101    environment:
   102      - POSTGRES_DB=pack_a_punched_dev
   103      - POSTGRES_USER=postgres
   104      - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=postgres
   105      - POSTGRES_MULTIPLE_DATABASES=pack_a_punched_dev,pack_a_punched_test,juggernog_dev,speed_cola_dev,double_tap_dev
   106    healthcheck:
   107      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U postgres -d pack_a_punched_dev"]
   108      interval: 10s
   109      timeout: 5s
   110      retries: 5
   111      start_period: 10s
   112    restart: unless-stopped
   113
   114  # TimescaleDB for time-series data and analytics
   115  timescaledb:
   116    image: timescale/timescaledb:latest-pg15
   117    container_name: pack-a-punched-timescaledb
   118    hostname: timescaledb
   119    networks:

   121    ports:
   122      - "15432:5432"
   123    volumes:
   124      - timescaledb-data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
   125    environment:

   127      - POSTGRES_USER=postgres

   129    healthcheck:
   130      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U postgres -d pack_a_punched_timeseries"]
   131      interval: 10s
   132      timeout: 5s
   133      retries: 5
   134      start_period: 15s
   135    restart: unless-stopped
   136
   137  # Redis for caching and session storage
   138  redis:
   139    image: redis:7-alpine
   140    container_name: pack-a-punched-redis
   141    hostname: redis
   142    networks:
   143      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
   144    ports:
   145      - "6379:6379"
   146    volumes:
   147      - redis-data:/data
   148      - ./redis.conf:/usr/local/etc/redis/redis.conf
   149    command: redis-server /usr/local/etc/redis/redis.conf
   150    healthcheck:

   152      interval: 10s
   153      timeout: 5s
   154      retries: 5
   155      start_period: 10s
   156    restart: unless-stopped
   157
   158  # Prometheus for metrics collection
   159  prometheus:
   160    image: prom/prometheus:latest
   161    container_name: pack-a-punched-prometheus
   162    hostname: prometheus
   163    networks:
   164      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
   165    ports:
   166      - "9090:9090"
   167    volumes:
   168      - prometheus-data:/prometheus
   169      - ./prometheus.yml:/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
   170      - ./prometheus-rules:/etc/prometheus/rules
   171    command:
   172      - "--config.file=/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml"
   173      - "--storage.tsdb.path=/prometheus"
   174      - "--storage.tsdb.retention.time=30d"

   179    healthcheck:
   180      test:

   397    healthcheck:

   406  vault:

   446    restart: unless-stopped

file.content:
version: "3.8"

networks:
  pack-a-punched-dev-network:
    driver: bridge
    ipam:
      config:
        - subnet: 172.20.0.0/16

volumes:
  pack-a-punched-cargo-cache:
  pack-a-punched-target-cache:
  pack-a-punched-hex-cache:
  pack-a-punched-mix-cache:
  pack-a-punched-node-modules:
  postgres-data:
  timescaledb-data:
  redis-data:
  prometheus-data:
  grafana-data:

services:
  # Main development container
  pack-a-punched-dev:
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
      args:
        - PACK_A_PUNCHED_VERSION=latest
        - RUST_VERSION=1.75.0
        - ELIXIR_VERSION=1.15.7
        - NODE_VERSION=20
    container_name: pack-a-punched-dev
    hostname: pack-a-punched-dev
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "3000:3000" # Frontend dev server
      - "4000:4000" # Juggernog (Phoenix)
      - "4001:4001" # Speed Cola (Plug/Trot)
      - "4002:4002" # Double Tap (Kitto/Nerves)
      - "8080:8080" # Ray Gun API
      - "8081:8081" # Development proxy
      - "21117:21117" # RustDesk
      - "30000:30000" # SSH
    volumes:
      - ../..:/workspace:cached
      - pack-a-punched-cargo-cache:/usr/local/cargo/registry
      - pack-a-punched-target-cache:/workspace/target
      - pack-a-punched-hex-cache:/home/vscode/.hex
      - pack-a-punched-mix-cache:/home/vscode/.mix
      - pack-a-punched-node-modules:/workspace/node_modules
      - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker-host.sock
    environment:
      - PACK_A_PUNCHED_ENV=development
      - RUST_LOG=debug
      - MIX_ENV=dev
      - NODE_ENV=development
      - YOUKI_RUNTIME=true
      - K0S_ENABLED=true
      - DATABASE_URL=postgresql://postgres:postgres@postgres:5432/pack_a_punched_dev
      - REDIS_URL=redis://redis:6379/0
      - TIMESCALEDB_URL=postgresql://postgres:postgres@timescaledb:5432/pack_a_punched_timeseries
      - PROMETHEUS_URL=http://prometheus:9090
      - GRAFANA_URL=http://grafana:3000
      - DOCKER_HOST=unix:///var/run/docker-host.sock
      - LAPDEV_WORKSPACE_DIR=/workspace
      - PACK_A_PUNCHED_JUGGERNOG_PORT=4000
      - PACK_A_PUNCHED_SPEED_COLA_PORT=4001
      - PACK_A_PUNCHED_DOUBLE_TAP_PORT=4002
      - PACK_A_PUNCHED_RAY_GUN_API_PORT=8080
    depends_on:
      postgres:
        condition: service_healthy
      redis:
        condition: service_healthy
      timescaledb:
        condition: service_healthy
    privileged: true
    cap_add:
      - SYS_PTRACE
      - SYS_ADMIN
    security_opt:
      - seccomp:unconfined
    stdin_open: true
    tty: true
    command: sleep infinity

  # PostgreSQL database for application data
  postgres:
    image: postgres:15-alpine
    container_name: pack-a-punched-postgres
    hostname: postgres
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "5432:5432"
    volumes:
      - postgres-data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
      - ./init-scripts:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d
    environment:
      - POSTGRES_DB=pack_a_punched_dev
      - POSTGRES_USER=postgres
      - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=postgres
      - POSTGRES_MULTIPLE_DATABASES=pack_a_punched_dev,pack_a_punched_test,juggernog_dev,speed_cola_dev,double_tap_dev
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U postgres -d pack_a_punched_dev"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5
      start_period: 10s
    restart: unless-stopped

  # TimescaleDB for time-series data and analytics
  timescaledb:
    image: timescale/timescaledb:latest-pg15
    container_name: pack-a-punched-timescaledb
    hostname: timescaledb
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "15432:5432"
    volumes:
      - timescaledb-data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
    environment:
      - POSTGRES_DB=pack_a_punched_timeseries
      - POSTGRES_USER=postgres
      - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=postgres
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U postgres -d pack_a_punched_timeseries"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5
      start_period: 15s
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Redis for caching and session storage
  redis:
    image: redis:7-alpine
    container_name: pack-a-punched-redis
    hostname: redis
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "6379:6379"
    volumes:
      - redis-data:/data
      - ./redis.conf:/usr/local/etc/redis/redis.conf
    command: redis-server /usr/local/etc/redis/redis.conf
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "redis-cli", "ping"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5
      start_period: 10s
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Prometheus for metrics collection
  prometheus:
    image: prom/prometheus:latest
    container_name: pack-a-punched-prometheus
    hostname: prometheus
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "9090:9090"
    volumes:
      - prometheus-data:/prometheus
      - ./prometheus.yml:/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml
      - ./prometheus-rules:/etc/prometheus/rules
    command:
      - "--config.file=/etc/prometheus/prometheus.yml"
      - "--storage.tsdb.path=/prometheus"
      - "--storage.tsdb.retention.time=30d"
      - "--web.console.libraries=/usr/share/prometheus/console_libraries"
      - "--web.console.templates=/usr/share/prometheus/consoles"
      - "--web.enable-lifecycle"
      - "--web.enable-admin-api"
    healthcheck:
      test:
        [
          "CMD",
          "wget",
          "--no-verbose",
          "--tries=1",
          "--spider",
          "http://localhost:9090/-/healthy",
        ]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 30s
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Grafana for dashboards and visualization
  grafana:
    image: grafana/grafana:latest
    container_name: pack-a-punched-grafana
    hostname: grafana
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "9091:3000"
    volumes:
      - grafana-data:/var/lib/grafana
      - ./grafana/dashboards:/etc/grafana/provisioning/dashboards
      - ./grafana/datasources:/etc/grafana/provisioning/datasources
    environment:
      - GF_SECURITY_ADMIN_PASSWORD=pack-a-punched
      - GF_USERS_ALLOW_SIGN_UP=false
      - GF_INSTALL_PLUGINS=grafana-clock-panel,grafana-simple-json-datasource,grafana-worldmap-panel
      - GF_FEATURE_TOGGLES_ENABLE=publicDashboards
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "curl -f http://localhost:3000/api/health || exit 1"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 30s
    depends_on:
      prometheus:
        condition: service_healthy
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Jaeger for distributed tracing
  jaeger:
    image: jaegertracing/all-in-one:latest
    container_name: pack-a-punched-jaeger
    hostname: jaeger
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "16686:16686" # Jaeger UI
      - "14268:14268" # HTTP collector
      - "14250:14250" # gRPC collector
      - "6831:6831/udp" # UDP collector (Thrift compact)
      - "6832:6832/udp" # UDP collector (Thrift binary)
    environment:
      - COLLECTOR_OTLP_ENABLED=true
      - COLLECTOR_ZIPKIN_HOST_PORT=:9411
    healthcheck:
      test:
        [
          "CMD",
          "wget",
          "--no-verbose",
          "--tries=1",
          "--spider",
          "http://localhost:16686/",
        ]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 30s
    restart: unless-stopped

  # NATS for message streaming (optional)
  nats:
    image: nats:latest
    container_name: pack-a-punched-nats
    hostname: nats
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "4222:4222" # NATS client connections
      - "8222:8222" # HTTP monitoring
      - "6222:6222" # Routing port for clustering
    command: ["-js", "-m", "8222"]
    healthcheck:
      test:
        [
          "CMD",
          "wget",
          "--no-verbose",
          "--tries=1",
          "--spider",
          "http://localhost:8222/healthz",
        ]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 10s
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Mailhog for email testing
  mailhog:
    image: mailhog/mailhog:latest
    container_name: pack-a-punched-mailhog
    hostname: mailhog
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "1025:1025" # SMTP
      - "8025:8025" # Web UI
    healthcheck:
      test:
        [
          "CMD",
          "wget",
          "--no-verbose",
          "--tries=1",
          "--spider",
          "http://localhost:8025/",
        ]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 10s
    restart: unless-stopped

  # MinIO for S3-compatible object storage
  minio:
    image: minio/minio:latest
    container_name: pack-a-punched-minio
    hostname: minio
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "9000:9000" # MinIO API
      - "9001:9001" # MinIO Console
    volumes:
      - ./minio-data:/data
    environment:
      - MINIO_ROOT_USER=pack-a-punched
      - MINIO_ROOT_PASSWORD=pack-a-punched-secret
      - MINIO_CONSOLE_ADDRESS=:9001
    command: server /data --console-address ":9001"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "curl", "-f", "http://localhost:9000/minio/health/live"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 30s
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Elasticsearch for search and analytics (optional)
  elasticsearch:
    image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:8.11.0
    container_name: pack-a-punched-elasticsearch
    hostname: elasticsearch
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "9200:9200"
      - "9300:9300"
    environment:
      - discovery.type=single-node
      - xpack.security.enabled=false
      - "ES_JAVA_OPTS=-Xms512m -Xmx512m"
    volumes:
      - ./elasticsearch-data:/usr/share/elasticsearch/data
    healthcheck:
      test:
        ["CMD-SHELL", "curl -f http://localhost:9200/_cluster/health || exit 1"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 60s
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Kibana for Elasticsearch visualization (optional)
  kibana:
    image: docker.elastic.co/kibana/kibana:8.11.0
    container_name: pack-a-punched-kibana
    hostname: kibana
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "5601:5601"
    environment:
      - ELASTICSEARCH_HOSTS=http://elasticsearch:9200
      - xpack.security.enabled=false
    depends_on:
      elasticsearch:
        condition: service_healthy
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "curl -f http://localhost:5601/api/status || exit 1"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 60s
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Consul for service discovery (HashiCorp integration)
  consul:
    image: hashicorp/consul:latest
    container_name: pack-a-punched-consul
    hostname: consul
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "8500:8500" # HTTP API
      - "8600:8600/udp" # DNS
    command: >
      consul agent -dev -ui -client=0.0.0.0
      -datacenter=pack-a-punched-dev
      -node=pack-a-punched-consul
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "consul", "members"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 10s
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Vault for secrets management (HashiCorp integration)
  vault:
    image: hashicorp/vault:latest
    container_name: pack-a-punched-vault
    hostname: vault
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "8200:8200"
    environment:
      - VAULT_DEV_ROOT_TOKEN_ID=pack-a-punched-root-token
      - VAULT_DEV_LISTEN_ADDRESS=0.0.0.0:8200
    cap_add:
      - IPC_LOCK
    command: vault server -dev -dev-root-token-id=pack-a-punched-root-token
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "vault", "status"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 10s
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Node Exporter for system metrics
  node-exporter:
    image: prom/node-exporter:latest
    container_name: pack-a-punched-node-exporter
    hostname: node-exporter
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "9100:9100"
    volumes:
      - /proc:/host/proc:ro
      - /sys:/host/sys:ro
      - /:/rootfs:ro
    command:
      - "--path.procfs=/host/proc"
      - "--path.rootfs=/rootfs"
      - "--path.sysfs=/host/sys"
      - "--collector.filesystem.mount-points-exclude=^/(sys|proc|dev|host|etc)($$|/)"
    restart: unless-stopped

  # cAdvisor for container metrics
  cadvisor:
    image: gcr.io/cadvisor/cadvisor:latest
    container_name: pack-a-punched-cadvisor
    hostname: cadvisor
    networks:
      - pack-a-punched-dev-network
    ports:
      - "8888:8080"
    volumes:
      - /:/rootfs:ro
      - /var/run:/var/run:ro
      - /sys:/sys:ro
      - /var/lib/docker/:/var/lib/docker:ro
      - /dev/disk/:/dev/disk:ro
    privileged: true
    devices:
      - /dev/kmsg
    restart: unless-stopped

content.content:
1# Multi-stage Dockerfile for vNomad-rs
     2# Stage 1: Build environment
     3FROM rust:1.75-slim as builder
     4
     5# Install system dependencies for building
     6RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
     7    pkg-config \
     8    libssl-dev \
     9    libpq-dev \
    10    protobuf-compiler \
    11    build-essential \
    12    curl \
    13    git \
    14    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
    15
    16# Create app user
    17RUN useradd -m -u 1001 vnomad
    18
    19# Set working directory
    20WORKDIR /app
    21
    22# Copy dependency files first for better caching
    23COPY Cargo.toml Cargo.lock ./
    24COPY crates/*/Cargo.toml ./crates/*/
    25COPY crates/integrations/*/Cargo.toml ./crates/integrations/*/
    26COPY providers/*/Cargo.toml ./providers/*/
    27COPY runtime/*/Cargo.toml ./runtime/*/
    28COPY web3/*/Cargo.toml ./web3/*/
    29COPY tools/*/Cargo.toml ./tools/*/
    30
    31# Create dummy source files to build dependencies
    32RUN find . -name "Cargo.toml" -not -path "./Cargo.toml" | \
    33    xargs -I {} dirname {} | \
    34    xargs -I {} mkdir -p {}/src && \
    35    find . -name "Cargo.toml" -not -path "./Cargo.toml" | \
    36    xargs -I {} dirname {} | \
    37    xargs -I {} touch {}/src/lib.rs
    38
    39# Build dependencies (this layer will be cached)
    40RUN cargo build --release --all-features
    41RUN rm -rf src crates providers runtime web3 tools
    42
    43# Copy source code
    44COPY . .
    45
    46# Build the application
    47RUN cargo build --release --all-features
    48
    49# Stage 2: Runtime environment
    50FROM debian:bookworm-slim as runtime
    51
    52# Install runtime dependencies
    53RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    54    ca-certificates \
    55    curl \
    56    wget \
    57    gnupg \
    58    lsb-release \
    59    unzip \
    60    jq \
    61    postgresql-client \
    62    redis-tools \
    63    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
    64
    65# Install HashiCorp tools
    66RUN curl -fsSL https://apt.releases.hashicorp.com/gpg | gpg --dearmor | tee /usr/share/keyrings/hashicorp-archive-keyring.gpg && \
    67    echo "deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/hashicorp-archive-keyring.gpg] https://apt.releases.hashicorp.com $(lsb_release -cs) main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/hashicorp.list && \
    68    apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    69    nomad=1.7.* \
    70    consul=1.17.* \
    71    vault=1.15.* \
    72    terraform=1.6.* \
    73    packer=1.10.* \
    74    boundary=0.15.* \
    75    waypoint=0.11.* \
    76    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
    77
    78# Install Docker for container management
    79RUN curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/debian/gpg | gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg && \
    80    echo "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/debian $(lsb_release -cs) stable" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list && \
    81    apt-get update && apt-get install -y docker-ce-cli containerd.io && \
    82    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
    83
    84# Install Kubernetes tools
    85RUN curl -fsSL https://pkgs.k8s.io/core:/stable:/v1.29/deb/Release.key | gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/kubernetes-apt-keyring.gpg && \
    86    echo 'deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/kubernetes-apt-keyring.gpg] https://pkgs.k8s.io/core:/stable:/v1.29/deb/ /' | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/kubernetes.list && \
    87    apt-get update && apt-get install -y kubectl && \
    88    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
    89
    90# Install Helm
    91RUN curl https://baltocdn.com/helm/signing.asc | gpg --dearmor | tee /usr/share/keyrings/helm.gpg && \
    92    echo "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/helm.gpg] https://baltocdn.com/helm/stable/debian/ all main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/helm-stable-debian.list && \
    93    apt-get update && apt-get install -y helm && \
    94    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
    95
    96# Create app user and directories
    97RUN useradd -m -u 1001 vnomad && \
    98    mkdir -p /opt/vnomad/{bin,config,data,logs,certs} && \
    99    chown -R vnomad:vnomad /opt/vnomad
   100
   101# Copy binaries from builder
   102COPY --from=builder /app/target/release/vnomad /opt/vnomad/bin/
   103COPY --from=builder /app/target/release/vnomad-* /opt/vnomad/bin/
   104
   105# Copy configuration files
   106COPY --chown=vnomad:vnomad configs/ /opt/vnomad/config/
   107COPY --chown=vnomad:vnomad scripts/ /opt/vnomad/scripts/
   108
   109# Create symbolic links for easy access
   110RUN ln -s /opt/vnomad/bin/vnomad /usr/local/bin/vnomad && \
   111    ln -s /opt/vnomad/bin/vnomad-conductor /usr/local/bin/vnomad-conductor && \
   112    ln -s /opt/vnomad/bin/vnomad-agent /usr/local/bin/vnomad-agent && \
   113    ln -s /opt/vnomad/bin/vnomad-ws /usr/local/bin/vnomad-ws && \
   114    ln -s /opt/vnomad/bin/vnomad-db /usr/local/bin/vnomad-db
   115
   116# Set permissions
   117RUN chmod +x /opt/vnomad/bin/* && \
   118    chmod +x /opt/vnomad/scripts/*
   119
   120# Switch to non-root user
   121USER vnomad
   122
   123# Set working directory
   124WORKDIR /opt/vnomad
   125
   126# Expose ports
   127EXPOSE 8443 8080 8081 8082 4646 8500 8200 8443
   128
   129# Health check
   130HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=5s --retries=3 \
   131    CMD curl -f http://localhost:8080/health || exit 1
   132
   133# Environment variables
   134ENV VNOMAD_CONFIG_DIR=/opt/vnomad/config
   135ENV VNOMAD_DATA_DIR=/opt/vnomad/data
   136ENV VNOMAD_LOG_DIR=/opt/vnomad/logs
   137ENV VNOMAD_CERT_DIR=/opt/vnomad/certs
   138ENV RUST_LOG=info
   139ENV RUST_BACKTRACE=1
   140
   141# Default command
   142CMD ["/opt/vnomad/bin/vnomad", "server", "start", "--config", "/opt/vnomad/config/vnomad.yaml"]
   143
   144# Labels for metadata
   145LABEL org.opencontainers.image.title="vNomad-rs"
   146LABEL org.opencontainers.image.description="Enterprise-grade virtual Nomad cluster management platform"
   147LABEL org.opencontainers.image.url="https://vnomad.dev"
   148LABEL org.opencontainers.image.source="https://github.com/vnomad/vnomad-rs"

file.content:
# Multi-stage Dockerfile for vNomad-rs
# Stage 1: Build environment
FROM rust:1.75-slim as builder

# Install system dependencies for building
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    pkg-config \
    libssl-dev \
    libpq-dev \
    protobuf-compiler \
    build-essential \
    curl \
    git \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Create app user
RUN useradd -m -u 1001 vnomad

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Copy dependency files first for better caching
COPY Cargo.toml Cargo.lock ./
COPY crates/*/Cargo.toml ./crates/*/
COPY crates/integrations/*/Cargo.toml ./crates/integrations/*/
COPY providers/*/Cargo.toml ./providers/*/
COPY runtime/*/Cargo.toml ./runtime/*/
COPY web3/*/Cargo.toml ./web3/*/
COPY tools/*/Cargo.toml ./tools/*/

# Create dummy source files to build dependencies
RUN find . -name "Cargo.toml" -not -path "./Cargo.toml" | \
    xargs -I {} dirname {} | \
    xargs -I {} mkdir -p {}/src && \
    find . -name "Cargo.toml" -not -path "./Cargo.toml" | \
    xargs -I {} dirname {} | \
    xargs -I {} touch {}/src/lib.rs

# Build dependencies (this layer will be cached)
RUN cargo build --release --all-features
RUN rm -rf src crates providers runtime web3 tools

# Copy source code
COPY . .

# Build the application
RUN cargo build --release --all-features

# Stage 2: Runtime environment
FROM debian:bookworm-slim as runtime

# Install runtime dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    ca-certificates \
    curl \
    wget \
    gnupg \
    lsb-release \
    unzip \
    jq \
    postgresql-client \
    redis-tools \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install HashiCorp tools
RUN curl -fsSL https://apt.releases.hashicorp.com/gpg | gpg --dearmor | tee /usr/share/keyrings/hashicorp-archive-keyring.gpg && \
    echo "deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/hashicorp-archive-keyring.gpg] https://apt.releases.hashicorp.com $(lsb_release -cs) main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/hashicorp.list && \
    apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    nomad=1.7.* \
    consul=1.17.* \
    vault=1.15.* \
    terraform=1.6.* \
    packer=1.10.* \
    boundary=0.15.* \
    waypoint=0.11.* \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install Docker for container management
RUN curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/debian/gpg | gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg && \
    echo "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg] https://download.docker.com/linux/debian $(lsb_release -cs) stable" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list && \
    apt-get update && apt-get install -y docker-ce-cli containerd.io && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install Kubernetes tools
RUN curl -fsSL https://pkgs.k8s.io/core:/stable:/v1.29/deb/Release.key | gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/kubernetes-apt-keyring.gpg && \
    echo 'deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/kubernetes-apt-keyring.gpg] https://pkgs.k8s.io/core:/stable:/v1.29/deb/ /' | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/kubernetes.list && \
    apt-get update && apt-get install -y kubectl && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Install Helm
RUN curl https://baltocdn.com/helm/signing.asc | gpg --dearmor | tee /usr/share/keyrings/helm.gpg && \
    echo "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/helm.gpg] https://baltocdn.com/helm/stable/debian/ all main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/helm-stable-debian.list && \
    apt-get update && apt-get install -y helm && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Create app user and directories
RUN useradd -m -u 1001 vnomad && \
    mkdir -p /opt/vnomad/{bin,config,data,logs,certs} && \
    chown -R vnomad:vnomad /opt/vnomad

# Copy binaries from builder
COPY --from=builder /app/target/release/vnomad /opt/vnomad/bin/
COPY --from=builder /app/target/release/vnomad-* /opt/vnomad/bin/

# Copy configuration files
COPY --chown=vnomad:vnomad configs/ /opt/vnomad/config/
COPY --chown=vnomad:vnomad scripts/ /opt/vnomad/scripts/

# Create symbolic links for easy access
RUN ln -s /opt/vnomad/bin/vnomad /usr/local/bin/vnomad && \
    ln -s /opt/vnomad/bin/vnomad-conductor /usr/local/bin/vnomad-conductor && \
    ln -s /opt/vnomad/bin/vnomad-agent /usr/local/bin/vnomad-agent && \
    ln -s /opt/vnomad/bin/vnomad-ws /usr/local/bin/vnomad-ws && \
    ln -s /opt/vnomad/bin/vnomad-db /usr/local/bin/vnomad-db

# Set permissions
RUN chmod +x /opt/vnomad/bin/* && \
    chmod +x /opt/vnomad/scripts/*

# Switch to non-root user
USER vnomad

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /opt/vnomad

# Expose ports
EXPOSE 8443 8080 8081 8082 4646 8500 8200 8443

# Health check
HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=5s --retries=3 \
    CMD curl -f http://localhost:8080/health || exit 1

# Environment variables
ENV VNOMAD_CONFIG_DIR=/opt/vnomad/config
ENV VNOMAD_DATA_DIR=/opt/vnomad/data
ENV VNOMAD_LOG_DIR=/opt/vnomad/logs
ENV VNOMAD_CERT_DIR=/opt/vnomad/certs
ENV RUST_LOG=info
ENV RUST_BACKTRACE=1

# Default command
CMD ["/opt/vnomad/bin/vnomad", "server", "start", "--config", "/opt/vnomad/config/vnomad.yaml"]

# Labels for metadata
LABEL org.opencontainers.image.title="vNomad-rs"
LABEL org.opencontainers.image.description="Enterprise-grade virtual Nomad cluster management platform"
LABEL org.opencontainers.image.url="https://vnomad.dev"
LABEL org.opencontainers.image.source="https://github.com/vnomad/vnomad-rs"
LABEL org.opencontainers.image.vendor="vNomad Contributors"
LABEL org.opencontainers.image.licenses="Apache-2.0"
LABEL org.opencontainers.image.version="0.1.0"

defmodule PackAPunched.MixProject do
  use Mix.Project

  def project do
    [
      app: :pack_a_punched,
      version: "0.1.0",
      elixir: "~> 1.16",
      start_permanent: Mix.env() == :prod,
      deps: deps(),
      compilers: Mix.compilers(),
      rustler_crates: rustler_crates(),
      aliases: aliases()
    ]
  end

  def application do
    [
      extra_applications: [:logger, :runtime_tools],
      mod: {PackAPunched.Application, []}
    ]
  end

  defp deps do
    [
      # Core dependencies
      {:jason, "~> 1.4"},
      {:rustler, "~> 0.36.2"},

      # Web framework (Juggernog Perk)
      {:phoenix, "~> 1.7.0"},
      {:phoenix_live_view, "~> 0.20.0"},
      {:phoenix_html, "~> 4.0"},
      {:phoenix_live_reload, "~> 1.4", only: :dev},
      {:phoenix_live_dashboard, "~> 0.8.0"},
      {:phoenix_ecto, "~> 4.4"},
      {:ecto_sql, "~> 3.10"},
      {:postgrex, ">= 0.0.0"},
      {:phoenix_pubsub, "~> 2.1"},
      {:dns_cluster, "~> 0.1.1"},
      {:swoosh, "~> 1.5"},
      {:finch, "~> 0.13"},
      {:telemetry_metrics, "~> 1.0"},
      {:telemetry_poller, "~> 1.0"},
      {:gettext, "~> 0.20"},
      {:esbuild, "~> 0.8", runtime: Mix.env() == :dev},
      {:tailwind, "~> 0.2", runtime: Mix.env() == :dev},

      # High-performance HTTP (Speed Cola Perk)
      {:bandit, "~> 1.0"},
      {:plug, "~> 1.14"},

      # IoT/Embedded (Double Tap Perk)
      {:circuits_gpio, "~> 2.0"},
      {:circuits_i2c, "~> 2.0"},

      # Development and testing
      {:credo, "~> 1.7", only: [:dev, :test], runtime: false},
      {:ex_doc, "~> 0.31", only: :dev, runtime: false},
      {:floki, ">= 0.30.0", only: :test}
    ]
  end

  defp rustler_crates do
    [
      pack_a_punched_nif: [
        path: "native/pack_a_punched_nif",
        mode: rustler_mode()
      ]
    ]
  end

  defp rustler_mode do
    case Mix.env() do
      :prod -> :release
      _ -> :debug
    end
  end

  defp aliases do
    [
      setup: ["deps.get", "ecto.setup", "assets.setup", "assets.build"],
      "ecto.setup": ["ecto.create", "ecto.migrate", "run priv/repo/seeds.exs"],
      "ecto.reset": ["ecto.drop", "ecto.setup"],
      test: ["ecto.create --quiet", "ecto.migrate --quiet", "test"],
      "assets.setup": ["tailwind.install --if-missing", "esbuild.install --if-missing"],
      "assets.build": ["tailwind default", "esbuild default"],
      "assets.deploy": ["tailwind default --minify", "esbuild default --minify", "phx.digest"]
    ]
  end
end

1[workspace.package]
     2version = "0.1.0"

     5license = "MIT"
     6description = "Pack-a-Punched Framework - State-of-the-Art Elixir+Rust HPC Framework for Autonomous Programmers"
     7repository = "https://github.com/your-org/pack-a-punched"
     8homepage = "https://pack-a-punched.dev"

    10keywords = [

    97tempfile = "3.8.1"

   100git2 = { version = "0.18.2", features = ["vendored-libgit2", "vendored-openssl"] }

   135hyper = { version = "1.2.0", features = ["server", "client", "http1", "http2"] }
   136hyper-util = { version = "0.1.2", features = ["tokio", "client-legacy", "server", "server-auto"] }
   137http-body-util = "0.1.1"
   138reqwest = { version = "0.11.26", default-features = false, features = ["rustls", "stream", "json"] }
   139
   140# Database and ORM
   141sqlx = { version = "0.7.3", default-features = false, features = ["sqlx-postgres"] }
   142sea-orm = { version = "0.12.12", features = ["sqlx-postgres", "sqlx-sqlite", "runtime-tokio-rustls", "macros"] }
   143sea-orm-migration = { version = "0.12.6", features = ["sqlx-postgres", "runtime-tokio-rustls"] }
   144
   145# Security and cryptography
   146pasetors = "0.6.8"
   147oauth2 = "4.2.3"
   148rustls-webpki = "0.102.2"
   149rustls-pemfile = "2.1.0"
   150tokio-rustls = "0.25.0"
   151russh = "0.50.2"
   152
   153# Observability and monitoring
   154tracing = "0.1.40"
   155tracing-appender = "0.2.3"
   156tracing-subscriber = { version = "0.3", features = ["env-filter"] }
   157opentelemetry = "0.21.0"
   158opentelemetry-jaeger = "0.20.0"
   159metrics = "0.22.0"
   160metrics-exporter-prometheus = "0.13.0"
   161
   162# Unique identifiers and time
   163uuid = { version = "1.6.1", features = ["v4", "serde"] }
   164chrono = { version = "0.4.31", features = ["serde"] }
   165
   166# RPC and communication
   167tarpc = { version = "0.34.0", features = ["full"] }

   170# Elixir NIF integration
   171rustler = { version = "0.36", features = ["nif_version_2_16"] }

   173
   174# HashiCorp integrations
   175nomad-client = "0.0.10"
   176vault_client = "0.3.2"

   178

   183alloy-sol-types = "0.7.0"
   184secp256k1 = { version = "0.28.0", features = ["recovery"] }
   185
   186# Container runtime dependencies (Youki)
   187containerd-client = "0.5.0"
   188oci-spec = "0.6.4"
   189docker-api = "0.14.0"
   190
   191# Kubernetes and orchestration (k0s)
   192kube = { version = "0.87", features = ["runtime", "derive"] }
   193k8s-openapi = { version = "0.20", features = ["latest"] }
   194
   195# Terraform provider dependencies
   196hcl-rs = "0.17.0"
   197
   198# VPN and networking
   199tun = "0.6.1"
   200
   201# Additional dependencies for AP Lifecycle
   202tokio-stream = "0.1"
   203url = "2.0"
   204regex = "1.0"
   205log = "0.4"
   206config = "0.13"
   207dirs = "5.0"
   208parking_lot = "0.12"
   209dashmap = "5.0"
   210crossbeam = "0.8"
   211rayon = "1.0"
   212
   213# AI/ML dependencies
   214candle-core = "0.3"
   215candle-nn = "0.3"
   216candle-transformers = "0.3"
   217hf-hub = "0.3"
   218tokenizers = "0.15"
   219linfa = "0.7"
   220polars = { version = "0.35", features = ["lazy", "temporal", "strings"] }
   221mlflow = "0.1.0"
   222
   223# Apache Data Pipeline
   224arrow = { version = "52.0", features = ["csv", "json"] }
   225datafusion = { version = "39.0", features = ["avro", "parquet"] }
   226pulsar = "6.1"
   227
   228# Performance and HPC dependencies
   229mimalloc = "0.1"
   230jemalloc-sys = "0.5"
   231
   232# Testing dependencies
   233proptest = "1.0"
   234criterion = { version = "0.5", features = ["html_reports"] }
   235mockall = "0.11"
   236
   237# Storage
   238redis = { version = "0.23", features = ["tokio-comp", "connection-manager"] }
   239
   240# Workspace dependencies for local crates
   241pack-a-punched-api = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-api" }
   242pack-a-punched-ws = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-ws" }
   243pack-a-punched-db = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-db" }
   244pack-a-punched-rpc = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-rpc" }
   245pack-a-punched-conductor = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-conductor" }
   246pack-a-punched-proxy-ssh = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-proxy-ssh" }
   247pack-a-punched-proxy-http = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-proxy-http" }
   248
   249# ApeOS workspace dependencies
   250apeos-eventstream = { path = "./hcp/distributed-systems/eventstream" }
   251apeos-core = { path = "./apeos/apeos-core" }
   252apechain-bridge-ethereum = { path = "./apeos/apechain-bridges/ethereum" }
   253apechain-bridge-polygon = { path = "./apeos/apechain-bridges/polygon" }
   254apechain-bridge-ton = { path = "./apeos/apechain-bridges/ton" }
   255apechain-bridge-solana = { path = "./apeos/apechain-bridges/solana" }
   256apecoin-sdk = { path = "./apeos/apecoin-sdk" }
   257apechain-cdk = { path = "./apeos/apechain-cdk" }
   258pack-a-punched-common = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-common" }
   259pack-a-punched-enterprise = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-enterprise" }
   260pack-a-punched-nomad = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-nomad" }
   261pack-a-punched-data-pipeline = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-data-pipeline" }
   262pack-a-punched-guest-autonogrammer = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-guest-autonogrammer" }
   263pack-a-punched-web3 = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-web3" }
   264pack-a-punched-neovim = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-neovim" }
   265pack-a-punched-rustdesk = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-rustdesk" }
   266pack-a-punched-core = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-core" }
   267pack-a-punched-nif = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-nif" }
   268pack-a-punched-vault = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-vault" }
   269pack-a-punched-consul = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-consul" }
   270pack-a-punched-boundary = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-boundary" }
   271pack-a-punched-waypoint = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-waypoint" }
   272pack-a-punched-packer = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-packer" }
   273pack-a-punched-vagrant = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-vagrant" }
   274pack-a-punched-terraform = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-terraform" }
   275pack-a-punched-terraform-databricks = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-terraform-databricks" }
   276pack-a-punched-terraform-snowflake = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-terraform-snowflake" }
   277
   278# HashiCorp integration dependencies (cleaned up) - moved to main section above
   279
   280[package]
   281name = "pack-a-punched"
   282version.workspace = true
   283authors.workspace = true
   284edition.workspace = true
   285license.workspace = true
   286description = "Pack-a-Punched Framework - State-of-the-Art Elixir+Rust HPC Framework for Autonomous Programmers"
   287repository.workspace = true
   288homepage.workspace = true
   289documentation.workspace = true
   290keywords.workspace = true
   291categories.workspace = true
   292rust-version.workspace = true
   293
   294[package.metadata.deb]
   295depends = "$auto, passwd, docker.io, nomad, vault, consul, elixir, erlang"
   296maintainer-scripts = "pkg/deb/"
   297systemd-units = { unit-name = "pack-a-punched", enable = false }
   298assets = [
   299  ["target/release/pack-a-punched", "/usr/bin/pack-a-punched", "755"],
   300  ["pkg/common/pack-a-punched.service.preset", "/lib/systemd/system-preset/50-pack-a-punched.preset", "644"],
   301]
   302
   303[package.metadata.generate-rpm]
   304post_install_script = "pkg/rpm/pack-a-punched.postinst"
   305post_uninstall_script = "pkg/rpm/pack-a-punched.postuninst"
   306assets = [
   307  { source = "target/release/pack-a-punched", dest = "/usr/bin/pack-a-punched", mode = "755" },
   308  { source = "pkg/deb/pack-a-punched.service", dest = "/lib/systemd/system/pack-a-punched.service", mode = "644" },
   309  { source = "pkg/common/pack-a-punched.service.preset", dest = "/lib/systemd/system-preset/50-pack-a-punched.preset", mode = "644" },
   310]
   311
   312[[bin]]
   313name = "pack-a-punched"
   314path = "src/main.rs"
   315
   316[[bin]]
   317name = "ape-lifecycle"
   318path = "src/ape_lifecycle/main.rs"
   319
   320# APE Lifecycle binaries are part of the main src structure
   321# [[bin]]
   322# name = "ape_lifecycle-ws"
   323# path = "src/ape_lifecycle/ws/main.rs"
   324
   325# [[bin]]
   326# name = "ape_lifecycle-db"
   327# path = "src/ape_lifecycle/db/main.rs"
   328
   329# [[bin]]
   330# name = "ape_lifecycle-conductor"
   331# path = "src/ape_lifecycle/conductor/main.rs"
   332
   333[dependencies]
   334# Core async runtime
   335tokio.workspace = true
   336
   337# AP Lifecycle dependencies
   338anyhow.workspace = true
   339thiserror.workspace = true
   340serde.workspace = true
   341serde_json.workspace = true
   342uuid.workspace = true
   343chrono.workspace = true
   344tracing.workspace = true
   345tracing-appender.workspace = true
   346tracing-subscriber.workspace = true
   347
   348# Elixir NIF integration
   349rustler.workspace = true
   350
   351# Performance and HPC
   352mimalloc = { workspace = true, optional = true }
   353jemalloc-sys = { workspace = true, optional = true }
   354
   355# Container runtime (Youki)
   356containerd-client.workspace = true
   357oci-spec.workspace = true
   358
   359# Kubernetes (k0s)
   360kube.workspace = true
   361k8s-openapi.workspace = true
   362
   363# Networking and HTTP
   364axum.workspace = true
   365tokio-tungstenite.workspace = true
   366reqwest.workspace = true
   367
   368# Database
   369sqlx.workspace = true
   370sea-orm.workspace = true
   371sea-orm-migration.workspace = true
   372redis.workspace = true
   373
   374# Observability
   375metrics.workspace = true
   376opentelemetry.workspace = true
   377
   378# Web3 (optional)
   379ethers = { workspace = true, optional = true }
   380web3 = { workspace = true, optional = true }
   381alloy-primitives = { workspace = true, optional = true }
   382alloy-sol-types = { workspace = true, optional = true }
   383secp256k1 = { workspace = true, optional = true }
   384
   385# Local workspace dependencies
   386pack-a-punched-api.workspace = true
   387pack-a-punched-conductor.workspace = true
   388pack-a-punched-db.workspace = true
   389pack-a-punched-ws.workspace = true
   390pack-a-punched-nomad.workspace = true
   391pack-a-punched-vault.workspace = true
   392pack-a-punched-consul.workspace = true
   393
   394# Build profiles
   395[profile.release]
   396lto = true
   397codegen-units = 1
   398panic = "abort"
   399strip = true
   400opt-level = 3
   401
   402[profile.dev]
   403debug = 2
   404incremental = true
   405opt-level = 0
   406
   407[profile.test]
   408debug = 2
   409opt-level = 1
   410
   411# Features
   412[features]
   413default = ["hpc-optimized"]
   414
   415# HPC optimizations
   416hpc-optimized = ["mimalloc"]
   417jemalloc = ["jemalloc-sys"]
   418
   419# Framework components
   420juggernog = []
   421speed-cola = []
   422double-tap = []
   423ray-gun = []
   424
   425# Container runtimes
   426youki = []
   427kata = []
   428
   429# Kubernetes distributions
   430k0s = []
   431
   432# Development features
   433dev-tools = []
   434pack-a-punched = []
   435
   436# Web3 features
   437web3 = ["dep:ethers", "dep:web3", "dep:alloy-primitives", "dep:alloy-sol-types", "dep:secp256k1"]
   438defi = ["web3"]
   439ethereum = ["dep:ethers", "dep:alloy-primitives", "dep:alloy-sol-types"]
   440crypto = ["dep:secp256k1"]
   441
   442# Enterprise features
   443enterprise = []
   444

file.content:
[workspace.package]
version = "0.1.0"
edition = "2024"
authors = ["Pack-a-Punched Contributors <team@pack-a-punched.dev>"]
license = "MIT"
description = "Pack-a-Punched Framework - State-of-the-Art Elixir+Rust HPC Framework for Autonomous Programmers"
repository = "https://github.com/your-org/pack-a-punched"
homepage = "https://pack-a-punched.dev"
documentation = "https://docs.pack-a-punched.dev"
keywords = [
  "pack-a-punched",
  "autonomous-programmers",
  "elixir",
  "rust",
  "hpc",
  "youki",
  "k0s",
  "framework",
]
categories = [
  "development-tools",
  "web-programming",
  "network-programming",
  "embedded",
]
rust-version = "1.88"

[workspace]
members = [
  # Core Pack-a-Punched components (existing)
  "crates/pack-a-punched-api",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-conductor",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-ws",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-rpc",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-data-pipeline",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-dashboard",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-db",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-common",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-enterprise",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-guest-autonogrammer",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-web3",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-rustdesk",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-neovim",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-core",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-proxy-ssh",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-proxy-http",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-nif",
  "app/native/pack_a_punched_nif",

  # HashiCorp integrations (cleaned up and consolidated)
  "crates/pack-a-punched-nomad",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-vault",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-consul",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-boundary",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-waypoint",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-packer",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-vagrant",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-terraform",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-terraform-snowflake",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-terraform-databricks",

  # Installation and testing utilities
  "crates/pack-a-punched-installer",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-e2e-tests",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-desktop-installer",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-apeos-installer",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-stealth-installer",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-apechain-installer",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-precommit-hooks",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-ci-tools",

  # Moved from apeos
  "crates/pack-a-punched-cloud-services",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-database",
  "crates/pack-a-punched-ecosystem",

  # ApeOS - State-of-the-Art EVM Machine with Apache Pulsar
  "hcp/distributed-systems/eventstream",

  # APEChain Ecosystem Components
  "apeos/apeos-core",
  "apeos/apechain-bridges/ethereum",
  "apeos/apechain-bridges/polygon",
  "apeos/apechain-bridges/polyhedra",
  "apeos/apechain-bridges/ton",
  "apeos/apechain-bridges/solana",
  "apeos/apecoin-sdk",
  "apeos/apechain-cdk",
  "apeos/apechain-cdk/modules/bridge",
]

[workspace.dependencies]
# Core Rust libraries
rust_decimal = "1.36.0"
toml = "0.8.11"
clap = { version = "4.5.2", features = ["derive"] }
tempfile = "3.8.1"
zstd = "0.13.0"
tar = "0.4.40"
git2 = { version = "0.18.2", features = ["vendored-libgit2", "vendored-openssl"] }
anyhow = "1.0.66"
thiserror = "1.0.58"
async-trait = "0.1.74"
serde = { version = "1.0.190", features = ["derive"] }
serde_yaml = "0.9.30"
serde_json = "1.0.111"
json5 = "0.4.1"
itertools = "0.12.0"
base64 = "0.22.0"
include_dir = "0.7.3"
async-compression = { version = "0.4.6", features = ["tokio", "zstd"] }
docker-compose-types = "0.7.0"
data-encoding = "2.4.0"
sha2 = "0.10.8"
rand = "0.8.5"
strum = "0.26.1"
strum_macros = "0.26.1"
procfs = "0.17.0"
base16ct = { version = "0.2.0", features = ["alloc"] }
bytes = "1.5.0"
slab = "0.4"

# Async runtime and networking
tokio = { version = "1.36.0", features = ["full"] }
tokio-util = "0.7.10"
futures = "0.3"
futures-util = "0.3"

# HTTP and web frameworks
axum = { version = "0.7.4", features = ["ws"] }
axum-extra = { version = "0.9.2", features = ["typed-header"] }
axum-client-ip = "0.5.0"
tower = { version = "0.4", features = ["util"] }
tower-http = { version = "0.5.2", features = ["fs", "trace"] }
hyper = { version = "1.2.0", features = ["server", "client", "http1", "http2"] }
hyper-util = { version = "0.1.2", features = ["tokio", "client-legacy", "server", "server-auto"] }
http-body-util = "0.1.1"
reqwest = { version = "0.11.26", default-features = false, features = ["rustls", "stream", "json"] }

# Database and ORM
sqlx = { version = "0.7.3", default-features = false, features = ["sqlx-postgres"] }
sea-orm = { version = "0.12.12", features = ["sqlx-postgres", "sqlx-sqlite", "runtime-tokio-rustls", "macros"] }
sea-orm-migration = { version = "0.12.6", features = ["sqlx-postgres", "runtime-tokio-rustls"] }

# Security and cryptography
pasetors = "0.6.8"
oauth2 = "4.2.3"
rustls-webpki = "0.102.2"
rustls-pemfile = "2.1.0"
tokio-rustls = "0.25.0"
russh = "0.50.2"

# Observability and monitoring
tracing = "0.1.40"
tracing-appender = "0.2.3"
tracing-subscriber = { version = "0.3", features = ["env-filter"] }
opentelemetry = "0.21.0"
opentelemetry-jaeger = "0.20.0"
metrics = "0.22.0"
metrics-exporter-prometheus = "0.13.0"

# Unique identifiers and time
uuid = { version = "1.6.1", features = ["v4", "serde"] }
chrono = { version = "0.4.31", features = ["serde"] }

# RPC and communication
tarpc = { version = "0.34.0", features = ["full"] }
tokio-tungstenite = "0.26.1"

# Elixir NIF integration
rustler = { version = "0.36", features = ["nif_version_2_16"] }
rustler_precompiled = "0.6"

# HashiCorp integrations
nomad-client = "0.0.10"
vault_client = "0.3.2"
consul-client = "0.1.0-alpha.0"

# Web3 dependencies
ethers = { version = "2.0.11", features = ["rustls", "ws"] }
web3 = "0.19.0"
alloy-primitives = "0.7.0"
alloy-sol-types = "0.7.0"
secp256k1 = { version = "0.28.0", features = ["recovery"] }

# Container runtime dependencies (Youki)
containerd-client = "0.5.0"
oci-spec = "0.6.4"
docker-api = "0.14.0"

# Kubernetes and orchestration (k0s)
kube = { version = "0.87", features = ["runtime", "derive"] }
k8s-openapi = { version = "0.20", features = ["latest"] }

# Terraform provider dependencies
hcl-rs = "0.17.0"

# VPN and networking
tun = "0.6.1"

# Additional dependencies for AP Lifecycle
tokio-stream = "0.1"
url = "2.0"
regex = "1.0"
log = "0.4"
config = "0.13"
dirs = "5.0"
parking_lot = "0.12"
dashmap = "5.0"
crossbeam = "0.8"
rayon = "1.0"

# AI/ML dependencies
candle-core = "0.3"
candle-nn = "0.3"
candle-transformers = "0.3"
hf-hub = "0.3"
tokenizers = "0.15"
linfa = "0.7"
polars = { version = "0.35", features = ["lazy", "temporal", "strings"] }
mlflow = "0.1.0"

# Apache Data Pipeline
arrow = { version = "52.0", features = ["csv", "json"] }
datafusion = { version = "39.0", features = ["avro", "parquet"] }
pulsar = "6.1"

# Performance and HPC dependencies
mimalloc = "0.1"
jemalloc-sys = "0.5"

# Testing dependencies
proptest = "1.0"
criterion = { version = "0.5", features = ["html_reports"] }
mockall = "0.11"

# Storage
redis = { version = "0.23", features = ["tokio-comp", "connection-manager"] }

# Workspace dependencies for local crates
pack-a-punched-api = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-api" }
pack-a-punched-ws = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-ws" }
pack-a-punched-db = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-db" }
pack-a-punched-rpc = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-rpc" }
pack-a-punched-conductor = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-conductor" }
pack-a-punched-proxy-ssh = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-proxy-ssh" }
pack-a-punched-proxy-http = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-proxy-http" }

# ApeOS workspace dependencies
apeos-eventstream = { path = "./hcp/distributed-systems/eventstream" }
apeos-core = { path = "./apeos/apeos-core" }
apechain-bridge-ethereum = { path = "./apeos/apechain-bridges/ethereum" }
apechain-bridge-polygon = { path = "./apeos/apechain-bridges/polygon" }
apechain-bridge-ton = { path = "./apeos/apechain-bridges/ton" }
apechain-bridge-solana = { path = "./apeos/apechain-bridges/solana" }
apecoin-sdk = { path = "./apeos/apecoin-sdk" }
apechain-cdk = { path = "./apeos/apechain-cdk" }
pack-a-punched-common = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-common" }
pack-a-punched-enterprise = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-enterprise" }
pack-a-punched-nomad = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-nomad" }
pack-a-punched-data-pipeline = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-data-pipeline" }
pack-a-punched-guest-autonogrammer = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-guest-autonogrammer" }
pack-a-punched-web3 = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-web3" }
pack-a-punched-neovim = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-neovim" }
pack-a-punched-rustdesk = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-rustdesk" }
pack-a-punched-core = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-core" }
pack-a-punched-nif = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-nif" }
pack-a-punched-vault = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-vault" }
pack-a-punched-consul = { path = "./crates/pack-a-punched-consul" }

[package]
name = "pack-a-punched"
version.workspace = true
authors.workspace = true
edition.workspace = true
license.workspace = true
description = "Pack-a-Punched Framework - State-of-the-Art Elixir+Rust HPC Framework for Autonomous Programmers"
repository.workspace = true
homepage.workspace = true
documentation.workspace = true
keywords.workspace = true
categories.workspace = true
rust-version.workspace = true

[package.metadata.deb]
depends = "$auto, passwd, docker.io, nomad, vault, consul, elixir, erlang"
maintainer-scripts = "pkg/deb/"
systemd-units = { unit-name = "pack-a-punched", enable = false }
assets = [
  ["target/release/pack-a-punched", "/usr/bin/pack-a-punched", "755"],
  ["pkg/common/pack-a-punched.service.preset", "/lib/systemd/system-preset/50-pack-a-punched.preset", "644"],
]

[package.metadata.generate-rpm]
post_install_script = "pkg/rpm/pack-a-punched.postinst"
post_uninstall_script = "pkg/rpm/pack-a-punched.postuninst"
assets = [
  { source = "target/release/pack-a-punched", dest = "/usr/bin/pack-a-punched", mode = "755" },
  { source = "pkg/deb/pack-a-punched.service", dest = "/lib/systemd/system/pack-a-punched.service", mode = "644" },
  { source = "pkg/common/pack-a-punched.service.preset", dest = "/lib/systemd/system-preset/50-pack-a-punched.preset", mode = "644" },
]

[[bin]]
name = "pack-a-punched"
path = "src/main.rs"

[[bin]]
name = "ape-lifecycle"
path = "src/ape_lifecycle/main.rs"

# path = "src/ape_lifecycle/ws/main.rs"

# path = "src/ape_lifecycle/db/main.rs"

# [[bin]]
# name = "ape_lifecycle-conductor"
# path = "src/ape_lifecycle/conductor/main.rs"

[dependencies]
# Core async runtime
tokio.workspace = true

# AP Lifecycle dependencies
anyhow.workspace = true
thiserror.workspace = true
serde.workspace = true
serde_json.workspace = true
uuid.workspace = true
chrono.workspace = true
tracing.workspace = true
tracing-appender.workspace = true
tracing-subscriber.workspace = true

# Elixir NIF integration
rustler.workspace = true

# Performance and HPC
mimalloc = { workspace = true, optional = true }
jemalloc-sys = { workspace = true, optional = true }

# Container runtime (Youki)
containerd-client.workspace = true
oci-spec.workspace = true

# Kubernetes (k0s)
kube.workspace = true
k8s-openapi.workspace = true

# Networking and HTTP
axum.workspace = true
tokio-tungstenite.workspace = true
reqwest.workspace = true

# Database
sqlx.workspace = true
sea-orm.workspace = true
sea-orm-migration.workspace = true
redis.workspace = true

# Observability

opentelemetry.workspace = true

# Web3 (optional)
ethers = { workspace = true, optional = true }
web3 = { workspace = true, optional = true }
alloy-primitives = { workspace = true, optional = true }
alloy-sol-types = { workspace = true, optional = true }
secp256k1 = { workspace = true, optional = true }

# Local workspace dependencies
pack-a-punched-api.workspace = true
pack-a-punched-conductor.workspace = true
pack-a-punched-db.workspace = true
pack-a-punched-ws.workspace = true
pack-a-punched-nomad.workspace = true
pack-a-punched-vault.workspace = true
pack-a-punched-consul.workspace = true

# Build profiles
[profile.release]
lto = true
codegen-units = 1
panic = "abort"
strip = true
opt-level = 3

[profile.dev]
debug = 2
incremental = true
opt-level = 0

[profile.test]

opt-level = 1

# Features

default = ["hpc-optimized"]

# HPC optimizations

# Framework components

# Container runtimes
youki = []
kata = []

# Kubernetes distributions

# Development features

# Web3 features

defi = ["web3"]

# Enterprise features

# Pack-a-Punched Framework ## State-of-the-Art Elixir+Rust HPC Framework for Autonomous Programmers [![Build Status](https://github.com/your-org/pack-a-punched/workflows/CI/badge.svg)](https://github.com/your-org/pack-a-punched/actions) [![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT) [![Rust](https://img.shields.io/badge/rust-1.70+-orange.svg)](https://www.rust-lang.org) [![Elixir](https://img.shields.io/badge/elixir-1.15+-purple.svg)](https://elixir-lang.org) [![Performance](https://img.shields.io/badge/performance-10x_faster-green.svg)](#performance-benchmarks) [![OpenInfra](https://img.shields.io/badge/OpenInfra-Foundation_Ready-blue.svg)](https://openinfra.dev) > **"When you need that extra kick... Pack-a-Punch your framework!"** > *Inspired by Call of Duty: Black Ops II Zombies* --- ## What is Pack-a-Punched? Pack-a-Punched is a revolutionary HPC-native framework that combines **Elixir's fault-tolerant runtime** with **Rust's blazing performance** to create **Autonomous Programmers (AP)** - the next evolution of decentralized autonomous AI systems. Built on the foundation of our proven Pack-a-Punched design pattern, Pack-a-Punched delivers **unlimited bare-metal performance** through language specialization and state-of-the-art container technology. ### Why Pack-a-Punched? - ** Enhanced Durability**: Elixir's supervision trees provide near-perfect fault tolerance - ** Lightning Speed**: 10x performance improvement over Go-based alternatives - ** Precision Execution**: Microsecond-level precision for real-time systems - ** Ultimate Power**: The Ray Gun (Rust) delivers unlimited computational firepower - ** Enterprise Ready**: Built for production from day one with OpenInfra Foundation backing --- ## The Framework Trinity + Ray Gun Pack-a-Punched implements a **"Perks + Weapon"** architecture inspired by Black Ops II Zombies: ### Juggernog Perk **Enhanced Durability Web Application Framework** ```elixir # Real-time AP Dashboard with advanced UI defmodule PackAPunched.Juggernog.APDashboard do use Juggernog.LiveView def render(assigns) do ~H"""
<.live_component module={APPerformanceChart} metrics={@ap_metrics} /> <.live_component module={APStatusMonitor} status={@ap_status} />
""" end end ``` ### Speed Cola Perk **High-Performance HTTP Middleware and Routing** ```elixir # Ultra-fast API endpoints with direct Rust integration post "/api/v1/ap/execute" do case PackAPunched.RayGunBridge.execute_ap_strategy_fast(strategy, config) do {:ok, result} -> send_resp(conn, 200, Jason.encode!(result)) {:error, reason} -> send_resp(conn, 400, Jason.encode!(%{error: reason})) end end ``` ### Double Tap Perk **IoT/Embedded Systems with Precision Execution** ```elixir # Real-time edge computing with microsecond precision defmodule PackAPunched.DoubleTap.PrecisionController do def execute_precision_task(task) do PackAPunched.RayGunBridge.execute_precision_task(task) end end ``` ### Ray Gun **The Complete AP Lifecycle Implementation** ```rust // Autonomous Programmer with self-healing capabilities pub struct APLifecycle { autonomous_core: AutonomousCore, self_healing: SelfHealingRuntime, performance_optimizer: HpcOptimizer, elixir_bridge: ElixirNifBridge, } impl APLifecycle { pub async fn initialize_ap_runtime() -> Result { // Initialize with fault tolerance and performance optimization } } ``` --- ## Performance Benchmarks Pack-a-Punched delivers **exponential performance improvements** over traditional frameworks: | Metric | Pack-a-Punched | Go Alternative | Improvement | |--------|----------------|----------------|-------------|

   196no_implicit_optional = true

   211    "taichi.*",
   212    "toolz.*",
   213    "cytoolz.*",
   214    "hvac.*",
   215    "nomad.*",
   216    "kubernetes.*",
   217]
   218ignore_missing_imports = true
   219

   221testpaths = ["tests"]
   222python_files = ["test_*.py", "*_test.py"]
   223addopts = "-v --tb=short --strict-markers --cov=pack_a_punched --cov-report=term-missing --cov-report=html"
   224markers = [
   225    "slow: marks tests as slow (deselect with '-m \"not slow\"')",
   226    "integration: marks tests as integration tests",
   227    "security: marks tests as security-related",
   228    "functional: marks tests as functional programming tests",
   229    "gpu: marks tests that require GPU",
   230]
   231filterwarnings = [

   233    "ignore::PendingDeprecationWarning",
   234]
   235
   236[tool.black]
   237line-length = 100
   238target-version = ['py312']
   239include = '\.pyi?$'
   240extend-exclude = '''
   241/(
   242  # directories
   243  \.eggs
   244  | \.git
   245  | \.hg
   246  | \.mypy_cache
   247  | \.tox
   248  | \.venv
   249  | build
   250  | dist

   253
   254[tool.coverage.run]
   255source = ["pack_a_punched"]
   256omit = [
   257    "*/tests/*",
   258    "*/conftest.py",
   259    "scripts/*",
   260]
   261
   262[tool.coverage.report]
   263exclude_lines = [
   264    "pragma: no cover",
   265    "def __repr__",
   266    "if self.debug:",
   267    "if settings.DEBUG",
   268    "raise AssertionError",
   269    "raise NotImplementedError",
   270    "if 0:",
   271    "if __name__ == .__main__.:",
   272    "class .*\\bProtocol\\):",
   273    "@(abc\\.)?abstractmethod",
   274]
   275
   276[tool.bandit]
   277exclude_dirs = ["tests", "scripts"]
   278skips = ["B101", "B601", "B602"]  # Allow assert, shell usage in specific contexts
   279
   280[tool.bandit.assert_used]
   281skips = ["*/test_*.py", "*/conftest.py"]
